head.title: Gay Marriage: A Variety of Lenses

hedline.hl1: Gay Marriage: A Variety of Lenses

abstract.p: Eric Rosenthal letter on Mar 4 article holds oponents of gay marriage fear wave of weddings of same-sex couples will show that claims of resulting societal harm lack merit

block.p: Re ''Senate Hears Testimony on a Gay Marriage Amendment'' (news article, March 4):
Re ''Senate Hears Testimony on a Gay Marriage Amendment'' (news article, March 4):
Perhaps the real concern for same-sex marriage opponents is that if gay people were allowed to marry routinely, hardly anyone would notice.

It was a challenge to find logical arguments opposing marriage before the first ceremonies were held. Now that hundreds of couples have been wed in California, Oregon, New Mexico and New York -- not to mention in several foreign countries over the last few years -- there is empirical evidence that claims of resulting harm to children, families and the country lack merit.
That evidence will continue to accumulate, especially once the Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court ruling takes effect in two months.
What will happen is likely to be very little at all. Couples will marry. Life will go on. Almost no one will care. And that is what scares the opponents most of all.
